content: It seems that somehow, we have forgotten to apply The Golden Rule to ourselves and to others. What fat shamers seem to forget is that commenting on some other human body is a supreme violation of personal space and not a simple entitled, verbalized insult. Once upon a time, parents taught their kids not say anything if they couldn’t think of anything decent to add to a conversation. In this day and age, we need to get past this feeling that we have a right to say whatever we want, when we want and everyone else has to get over it. Deliberate unkind actions reflect on who we are as individuals and say nothing about the person being criticized. Or, in my day, we said “I am rubber, you are glue…whatever you say bounces off me and sticks to you.”
